channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti, 20th September
item.description:
On Haslemere Road at the junction with Long Lane, Bexleyheath: Please could you remove black graffiti from the white road name plate for Haslemere Road and from the top of a green street cabinet on the pavement as seen in the attached picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Haslemere Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Lamp Out & central reservation crossing, 20th September
item.description:
Both the street lamp and the central reservation crossing lets are out, making the pathway down Watling Street impossible to see when dark. And that's not to mention to difficulty people are having with the paving/tarmac but the the tree roots that have left the pathway/walkway and extreme trip Hazard. Thank you in advance for you assistance/cooperation.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Watling Street, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Item, 20th September
item.description:
On Haslemere Road at the junction with Long Lane, Bexleyheath: Please could you remove a dumped item from behind a green street cabinet on the pavement as seen in the attached picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Haslemere Road, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Overgrown hedge blocking pavement, 20th September
item.description:
97 Dalyell Road rose bush in front garden overgrown blocking pavement. Bins to the property also on pavement further blocking access

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dalyell Road, Stockwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping rubbish, 20th September
item.description:
I did report this last week but still waiting for this to be collected, the problem is from private landlords in simm road houses and not the flats. They are constantly dumping their rubbish and it’s done late at night, we are sick of this and to solve a problem would be a camera. As a tenant from 2 Beatrice Road gets her two friends to empty her four bins in to our recycle bins every week, for the past 2 years it needs to stop.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Strathnairn Street, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1A, Arbrook Close, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Contraflow bikelane desperately needed, 20th September
item.description:
Bikes have to use this road to and from church st, there needs to be a safe protected cycle lane on this road going both directions (it's plenty wide enough) it's families taking their children to nursery
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cottage Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ongoing issues with Black & Blue bin Collections ., 20th September
item.description:
12/09/25 *Black bin for my flat left part locking gate entrance *Refuse protruding *Blue Bin left on pavement * Operative overheard saying he wouldn't empty my bin. 19/09/25 Blue bin left upturned in front garden -pic won't attach- will email.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Greenwood Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A bin has randomly appeared on College Cross, 20th September
item.description:
A bin which is of the style on upper street has been located in the middle of the pavement without any warning and this triggers people to dump rubbish including dog poo bags. This is not a main road and there is no reason for a bin to have been put there.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, College Cross, Highbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive number of bikes outside of designated parking zone, 20th September
item.description:
There are a significant number of bikes many of which are on the public highway rather than in the designated area. This is increasingly problematic as some also get left on pavements. There seems to be no controlling of the designated areas.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, College Cross, Highbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox in our drive, 20th September
item.description:
The fox is dead on our drive at 426 Erith Road DA8 3NJ must have died under our car which isn’t driven much. We moved the car today and found the dead fox which also explains the smell we have had in our front of the house. Can we please get this removed please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnehurst Avenue, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
